programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: The four-day event, which is being staged for the sixth time, features 16 teams competing in 40 games, and there are 14 schools that appeared in the 2024 NCAA Tournament, including three teams that reached the Women's College World Series.

programme.title: TGL Golf
programme.desc: Atlanta Drive GC, which plays its second match of the day after facing Los Angeles Golf Club in Match 1, is led by captain Justin Thomas; The Bay Golf Club consists of the team of Ludvig Aberg, Wyndham Clark, Min Woo Lee and Shane Lowry.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: The four-day event, which is being staged for the sixth time, features 16 teams competing in 40 games, and there are 14 schools that appeared in the 2024 NCAA Tournament, including three teams that reached the Women's College World Series.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Notre Dame claimed a 70-62 victory over Duke in their lone meeting from the 2023-24 season on Feb. 19, led by 23 points and 4 steals from Hannah Hidalgo; Reigan Richardson posted 23 points and 2 assists for the Blue Devils in the home loss.

programme.title: TGL Golf
programme.desc: Atlanta Drive GC (1-0-0) is the only team that has yet to concede a hole after defeating New York Golf Club, 4-0, on Jan. 21; Los Angeles Golf Club (2-0-0) sits atop the SoFi Cup Standings after its 6-2 win over Boston Common Golf on Feb. 4.

programme.title: Top Rank Boxing on ESPN
programme.desc: Started in 1973 by Bob Arum and Jabir Herbert Muhammad, Top Rank Boxing showcases some of the biggest names in the sport as one of the premier promoters, as fighters move up the rankings in their weight classes to earn a title bout.

programme.title: Top Rank Boxing on ESPN
programme.desc: Started in 1973 by Bob Arum and Jabir Herbert Muhammad, Top Rank Boxing showcases some of the biggest names in the sport as one of the premier promoters, as fighters move up the rankings in their weight classes to earn a title bout.

programme.title: Premier Lacrosse League
programme.desc: The top four teams in the last year's regular-season standings meet for a berth in the Championship on Feb. 16; Boston Cannons defeated Philadelphia Waterdogs in overtime in last year's edition, 23-22, as Matt Kavanagh scored the game-winner.

programme.title: First Draft
programme.desc: ESPN experts Field Yates and Mel Kiper Jr. follow the NFL Draft throughout the year, breaking down the stock of players who have risen and fallen during the college football season, what each team needs to draft and the latest trade news.

programme.title: SC Featured
programme.desc: An in-depth examination of a particular athlete or issue that has captured the attention of sports fanatics across the nation; coverage includes exclusive interviews, exhaustive reporting and extensive expert analysis regarding the subject.

programme.title: Premier Lacrosse League
programme.desc: The top four teams from the 2024 regular season battle in a six-on-six format in six games of round-robin competition; the winner of each semifinal advances to meet for the title in the Championship; Boston Cannons are the defending champions.

programme.title: League One Volleyball
programme.desc: The top two teams from the LOVB Classic battle for the Championship at Municipal Arena in Kansas City, Missouri after two rounds of knockouts; Atlanta and Omaha had byes from the quarter-finals being the no. 1 and no. 2 seeds respectively.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Evan Cohen, Chris Canty and Michelle Smallmon discuss the latest stories from around the world of sports making headlines, previewing some of the biggest games in the coming days, and guest interviews to gather their unique perspective.

programme.title: Women's Lacrosse
programme.desc: After teams play a series of games to determine the playoff seedings, the top three teams advance, with the second-place team facing the third-place team to determine who meets the top-ranked team for the title in the inaugural edition of the series.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: With the help of Shaquille O'Neal and Penny Hardaway, the Orlando Magic franchise vaulted to the top of the NBA in the 90s and became a pop culture phenomenon, but as with all stories, the fairy tale came to an end when Shaq departed for the Lakers.

programme.title: UFC Unleashed
programme.desc: Through the use of archived footage, big fights from previous UFC cards are featured to show some of the top matches that have occurred over the years, as belts are put on the line, reputations are challenged and rivals battle for victory.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Isiah Thomas, Joe Dumars, Rick Mahorn, Dennis Rodman and Bill Laimbeer led the Detroit Pistons to back-to-back NBA championships in 1989 and 1990, but the team's tactics earned them a tough reputation and a memorable nickname that has endured.

programme.title: UFC Main Event
programme.desc: Dominick Cruz (22-2, 7 KO's) has beaten his last 12 opponents, and defeated Faber by unanimous decision in their last meeting at UFC 132, on Jul. 2, 2011; Uriah Faber (33-8, 7 KO's) is coming off a win over Frankie Saenz at UFC 194 on Dec. 12, 2015.

programme.title: UFC Live
programme.desc: Analysts preview UFC 303 and break down the main event as Alex Pereira (10-2-0) defends his light heavyweight title against Jiri Prochazka (30-4-1); other bouts include Brian Ortega (16-3) going up against Diego Lopes (24-6) in a featherweight bout.

programme.title: 30 for 30

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: William Byron secured his first win in "The Great American Race" last year, narrowly edging out Alex Bowman after the race went under caution; Joey Logano won four races last season en route to winning his third Cup Series championship.

programme.title: Global Rise of Flag Football
programme.desc: Exploring the growth of flag football around the United States and the world.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: The winner in the semifinal matchup between E J Tackett and Timmy Tan, as well as the victor between Tim Foy Jr. and Dom Barrett advance to compete for the top prize of $30,000; Anthony Simonsen of Las Vegas took home the title in 2024.

programme.title: The American Rodeo
programme.desc: The American Contender Tournament offers qualifying rounds across eight rodeo disciplines: Tie-Down Roping, Steer Wrestling, Saddle Bronc Riding, Bareback Riding, Barrel Racing, Break Away Roping, Team Roping and Bull Riding.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Iowa (14-10, 5-8) ended a three-game skid with an 84-73 win over Rutgers; No. 25 Maryland (19-6, 9-5) is 14-1 at home behind freshman Derik Queen, who leads the team with 15.9 ppg, and won both meetings with the Hawkeyes last season.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: NFL Films Presents
programme.desc: The National Football League presents a closer, documentary-style look at the teams and towns featured prominently each Sunday in the league, as well as a look at the most enigmatic personalities of the league and the impressive plays of the weekend.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: William Byron secured his first win in "The Great American Race" last year, narrowly edging out Alex Bowman after the race went under caution; Joey Logano won four races last season en route to winning his third Cup Series championship.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: The winner in the semifinal matchup between E J Tackett and Timmy Tan, as well as the victor between Tim Foy Jr. and Dom Barrett advance to compete for the top prize of $30,000; Anthony Simonsen of Las Vegas took home the title in 2024.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Coverage of college basketball games.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Kansas State claimed a 65-62 victory over West Virginia in March's Big 12 quarter-finals round, led by 22 points and 11 rebounds from Ayoka Lee; JJ Quinerly posted 27 points and 4 rebounds for the Mountaineers in the postseason loss.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: 26th Annual Super Bowl Soulful Celebration
programme.desc: Professional football players and Grammy award-winning musicians share inspiring messages at the Mahalia Jackson Theater of Performing Arts in New Orleans.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Iowa and Ohio State split wins in their two meetings from the 2023-24 season, with the Hawkeyes claiming a 93-83 victory in the final matchup on March 3; Caitlin Clark posted 35 points and 9 assists for the Hawkeyes in the home win.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Covering gossip, scandal and the everyday lives of athletes in college and professional sports, the crew comically highlights exclusive footage of the superstars spotted around Hollywood, New York City and other parts of the country.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Iowa (14-10, 5-8) ended a three-game skid with an 84-73 win over Rutgers; No. 25 Maryland (19-6, 9-5) is 14-1 at home behind freshman Derik Queen, who leads the team with 15.9 ppg, and won both meetings with the Hawkeyes last season.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: William Byron secured his first win in "The Great American Race" last year, narrowly edging out Alex Bowman after the race went under caution; Joey Logano won four races last season en route to winning his third Cup Series championship.

programme.title: NASCAR Race Classic
programme.desc: Mike Skinner starts the 500-mile race from the pole position and is joined on the front row by Steve Grissom; Dale Jarrett, who won the 200-lap race in 1996, and Dale Earnhardt start from Row 2 with Ernie Irvan and Jeff Gordon starting from Row 3.

programme.title: 2025 Concacaf Men's U-17 Qualifiers
programme.desc: Cuba and the United States last met in the second stage of the CONCACAF Championship on May 5, 2017, where the US claimed a 6-2 victory over Cuba; Timothy Weah found the net with a brace for the US in the win while each team had an own goal.

programme.title: ARCA Racing
programme.desc: The ARCA Menards Series heads to the Ride the 'Dente 200 at Daytona International Speedway for the opening race of the season in Daytona Beach, Florida; Gus Dean claimed the race win at Daytona in the season opener from the 2024 season.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: 2025 Concacaf Men's U-17 Qualifiers
programme.desc: Bermuda is coming off of claiming a 3-1 victory over Anguilla on Feb. 9, led by a pair of goals from Kennahz Fray and 2 assists by Noah Outerbridge; Canada also comes off a win over Anguilla, on Feb. 11, 8-0, behind an Aidan Evans brace.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 24 Creighton (18-7, 11-3) had its nine-win streak snapped by UConn, 70-66, but beat the Red Storm, 57-56, on Dec. 31; No. 9 St. John's (21-4, 12-2) is 15-0 at home behind RJ Luis Jr., who is fourth in the Big East with 17.4 ppg.

programme.title: America's Day at the Races
programme.desc: Nationwide coverage of thoroughbred racing from venues around the country, showcasing major stakes races with in-depth analysis from expert handicappers; coverage includes the latest horse racing news, exclusive interviews and insightful commentary.

programme.desc: Professional football players and Grammy award-winning musicians share inspiring messages at the Mahalia Jackson Theater of Performing Arts in New Orleans.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Ty Majeski won the finale at Phoenix last year over Corey Heim to claim his first Truck Series Championship; Nick Sanchez averaged 98.933 mph en route to his win in the opener last year, beating Heim under caution for his first Truck Series win.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: EJ Tackett, who looks to win his 25th career title and move into a tie with Brian Voss for 11th all-time, leads the tour in points through two events; Graham Fach won the season opener.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour

programme.title: Bassmasters
programme.desc: The top anglers across the country compete in a series of annual events that makes up bass fishing's most competitive league, featuring millions of dollars in prizes, tournaments taking place throughout the U.S., and coverage of all the major phases.
